commit_message:
Ensure that repo checks use the right values

When executing the check for the appropriate files on
the repo host and then overriding the group_vars to
cater for when the repo is not present, we need to make
sure that we're doing the checks against the right URL.

In this patch we backup the default URL so that it can
be used when re-executing the check later in the same
playbook.

Also, given that the set-pip-upstream-url.yml and
set-upper-constraints.yml task sets are always used
together, we combine them into one task set.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/563578
Change-Id: I040c4f5b6e96c85c68beb975f7b80d1edf42276d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-23 23:20:30.000000000', 'message': 'Make reconstructor go faster with --override-devices

The object reconstructor will now fork all available worker processes
when operating on a subset of local devices.

Example:
  A system has 24 disks, named "d1" through "d24"
  reconstructor_workers = 8
  invoked with --override-devices=d1,d2,d3,d4,d5,d6

In this case, the reconstructor will now use 6 worker processes, one
per disk. The old behavior was to use 2 worker processes, one for d1,
d3, and d5 and the other for d2, d4, and d6 (because 24 / 8 = 3, so we
assigned 3 disks per worker before creating another).

I think the new behavior better matches operators' expectations. If I
give a concurrent program six tasks to do and tell it to operate on up
to eight at a time, I'd expect it to do all six tasks at once, not run
two concurrent batches of three tasks apiece.

This has no effect when --override-devices is not specified. When
operating on all local devices instead of a subset, the new and old
code produce the same result.

The reconstructor's behavior now matches the object replicator's
behavior.

Change-Id: Ib308c156c77b9b92541a12dd7e9b1a8ea8307a30

The reconstructor's behavior now matches the object replicator's

Change-Id: Ib308c156c77b9b92541a12dd7e9b1a8ea8307a30
'}, {'created': '2018-04-25 18:30:02.000000000', 'message': 'Make reconstructor go faster with --override-devices

  invoked with --override-devices=d1,d2,d3,d4,d5,d6

commit_message:
Make reconstructor go faster with --override-devices

The object reconstructor will now fork all available worker processes
when operating on a subset of local devices.

Example:
  A system has 24 disks, named "d1" through "d24"
  reconstructor_workers = 8
  invoked with --override-devices=d1,d2,d3,d4,d5,d6

In this case, the reconstructor will now use 6 worker processes, one
per disk. The old behavior was to use 2 worker processes, one for d1,
d3, and d5 and the other for d2, d4, and d6 (because 24 / 8 = 3, so we
assigned 3 disks per worker before creating another).

I think the new behavior better matches operators' expectations. If I
give a concurrent program six tasks to do and tell it to operate on up
to eight at a time, I'd expect it to do all six tasks at once, not run
two concurrent batches of three tasks apiece.

This has no effect when --override-devices is not specified. When
operating on all local devices instead of a subset, the new and old
code produce the same result.

The reconstructor's behavior now matches the object replicator's
behavior.

Change-Id: Ib308c156c77b9b92541a12dd7e9b1a8ea8307a30

commit_message:
Allow pypowervm 1.1.15

The referenced bug breaks PowerVM device detach during destroy (and
therefore PowerVM CI) in Nova.  A new oslo.versionedobjects is to be
released soon which will also work around it, but the pypowervm fix is
good regardless.

Change-Id: Id2a7767f604d707a35727e86ff64a8fb462c3a7d
Related-Bug: #1766692

commit_message:
Add neutron "segments" plugin to the default list

[1] Added a tests which requires "segments" plugin but
we don't have it enabled in overcloud. It is enabled in
neutron jobs from long[2]. This patch adds this plugin
to the default enabled plugins.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558609/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/459439/

Related-Bug: #1765008
Change-Id: I1bc36c4533dcaadd81d7c93a194e9319217c69cd

commit_message:
Fix the passlib deprecation warning

passlib.utils is now deprecated, the usage has been updated based on the
following deprecation warning.

    DeprecationWarning: the function passlib.utils.generate_password() is
    deprecated as of Passlib 1.7, and will be removed in Passlib 2.0, use
    passlib.pwd.genword() / passlib.pwd.genphrase() instead.

Closes-Bug: #1765092
Change-Id: Ibbcad6117c57d45c6f213d545d143efbc73a1ff8

commit_message:
Return any errors from called actions in node delete

The node delete action (ScaleDownAction) wasn't passing errors back
from called actions. This results in the workflow continuing to look
for a stack to go to INPROGRESS that never will.

Change-Id: Ia43e0a06215ad19d4b49f1721026db7519220799
Partial-Bug: #1749426

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-24 20:09:43.000000000', 'message': "Don't set deployments as hostvars

This patch updates config-download to not create a vars file under
group_vars for the server deployments. These variables end up as
hostvars in Ansible, which has caused many escaping problems since
hostvars are run through the templating engine.

In combination with I06c9b3256567cc57d599bd4d9af617c718d2314f, these
escaping problems should be eliminated.

Additionally, by not using hostvars (set_fact), we can save memory since
a hostvar is set on a host and persisted in memory. With many hosts and
large deployments (such as all hiera data), this would have eventually
been an issue.

Instead, an Ansible lookup is used in deployments.yaml to read
deployment data, which are now written to individual files by
config-download. This also improves readability instead of having one
big file of all deployment data.

Change-Id: Ie09fc64cf85eb532f31684f1c9808b942672ff41
Closes-Bug: #1760990
(cherry picked from commit 60f25d2bcd08d58b3bbbe63a1c9b9e156c5ab5cc)
"}, {'created': '2018-04-24 20:11:17.000000000', 'message': "Don't set deployments as hostvars

In combination with I06c9b3256567cc57d599bd4d9af617c718d2314f, these
escaping problems should be eliminated.

Additionally, by not using hostvars (set_fact), we can save memory since
a hostvar is set on a host and persisted in memory. With many hosts and
large deployments (such as all hiera data), this would have eventually
been an issue.

Instead, an Ansible lookup is used in deployments.yaml to read
deployment data, which are now written to individual files by
config-download. This also improves readability instead of having one
big file of all deployment data.

Change-Id: Ie09fc64cf85eb532f31684f1c9808b942672ff41
Closes-Bug: #1760990
Closes-Bug: #1763779
(cherry picked from commit 60f25d2bcd08d58b3bbbe63a1c9b9e156c5ab5cc)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't set deployments as hostvars

This patch updates config-download to not create a vars file under
group_vars for the server deployments. These variables end up as
hostvars in Ansible, which has caused many escaping problems since
hostvars are run through the templating engine.

In combination with I06c9b3256567cc57d599bd4d9af617c718d2314f, these
escaping problems should be eliminated.

Additionally, by not using hostvars (set_fact), we can save memory since
a hostvar is set on a host and persisted in memory. With many hosts and
large deployments (such as all hiera data), this would have eventually
been an issue.

Instead, an Ansible lookup is used in deployments.yaml to read
deployment data, which are now written to individual files by
config-download. This also improves readability instead of having one
big file of all deployment data.

Change-Id: Ie09fc64cf85eb532f31684f1c9808b942672ff41
Closes-Bug: #1760990
Closes-Bug: #1763779
(cherry picked from commit 60f25d2bcd08d58b3bbbe63a1c9b9e156c5ab5cc)

commit_message:
Don't exit on a RUNNING message for deploy workflow

This workflow is being updated to return a RUNNING status when the
workflow starts, so we don't want to assert that SUCCESS is the only
valid outcome anymore.

Related blueprint config-download-workflows

Co-Authored-By: Dougal Matthews <dougal@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1766216
Change-Id: I78b4fc7673a4039ed7ef32b16bb2850411f7fcc6

[{'created': '2018-03-22 12:14:34.000000000', 'message': 'Explicitly set nova/neutron/ceilometer host to expected fqdn

This avoids any issues where the host/domainname is altered by a DHCP lease.
Also the puppet/facter fqdn can be unpredictable when there are multiple NICs.

commit_message:
Explicitly set nova/neutron/ceilometer host to expected fqdn

This avoids any issues where the host/domainname is altered by a DHCP lease.
Also the puppet/facter fqdn can be unpredictable when there are multiple NICs.

Change-Id: I7ed52727d1515ee7f191a82b0b1d645a9d597cd3
Closes-bug: 1758034

commit_message:
Use --roles in overcloud upgrade run.

Once [0] got merged, it's possible to specify
a set of hosts (--nodes) or TripleO roles
(--roles) when calling 'overcloud upgrade run'.
Therefore, according the way tripleo-upgrade
obtains the elements to run the upgrade into,
this parameter should be --roles.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/550099/4/

Change-Id: I4c32d7c10ae368f1d0833eb282d26f3232ea7355
(cherry picked from commit 78a772432e50adb1ce0c27e4699d5b5e0dbbcad0)

Use the existing nova-compute cellv2 discovery logic for nova-ironic too, now
that we have the --by-service flag.
The nova_api_discover_hosts.sh script will now wait (up to 10 minutes) for all
nova-compute and nova-ironic services to register, then run host discovery

(cherry picked from commit 9d61779a231924588d5a67d85d006fa4111215a8)
'}]
commit_message:
Improve nova-ironic cellv2 discovery

Use the existing nova-compute cellv2 discovery logic for nova-ironic too, now
that we have the --by-service flag.
The nova_api_discover_hosts.sh script will now wait (up to 10 minutes) for all
nova-compute and nova-ironic services to register, then run host discovery
with --by-service to create host mappings for all services. We no longer need
ironic nodes to be deployed on the nova-ironic services for discovery to work.
We also no longer need to enable the priodic job.

Related nova change Ie9f064cb9caf6dcba2414acb24d12b825df45fab

Related-Bug: #1755602
Change-Id: I723237ae7285f3babd6eceb1ce7da4e2734d1e4f
(cherry picked from commit 9d61779a231924588d5a67d85d006fa4111215a8)

commit_message:
Unity: fail to detach lun when auto zone enabled

When the lun is the last one attached to the host and it is detached,
the attribute `host.host_luns` is None. Use `not` in if statement which
is pythonic in checking None and empty list of `host.host_luns`.

Change-Id: I5d8f63f9a78d001bc699af538f586aab8d73a5cf
Closes-bug: #1759175
(cherry picked from commit c816be897e7ab1c95b38979b2cc94ecf179e44e7)

commit_message:
Add volumes list of docker-puppet container when merging config volumes

When config volumes of same types are merged, the volumes to be mounted
for the continer is not merged. In order to run neutron container with
ovs agent, '/run/openvswitch' directory mount is required to execute
ovs-vsctl commands. This patch merges the volumes list of the same
config volumes instead of taking only the first one.

Closes-Bug: #1766759
Change-Id: I70972ad2fc339c9316befd74dda8555982f23316

messages: [{'account_id': 17888, 'date': '2018-04-24 13:55:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21909, 'date': '2018-04-25 12:33:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9317, 'date': '2018-04-25 13:01:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-24 13:55:09.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Switch VLANs validation

The "Compare switch VLANs to VLANs in nic config" validation breaks when
run through Mistral. This is because the custom module used in the
validation imports functions from another custom module. Custom modules
are recognized by Ansible, but they don't necessarily live on the Python
path, so when run through Mistral the imported module cannot be found
and the validation breaks.

This patch moves the two imported functions to different locations:

- `library.network_environment.get_network_config` is refactored into a
  generic utility function in `tripleo_validations.utils`.
- `library.network_environment.open_network_environment_files` is copied
  to `library.network_environment.switch_vlans` (this is an ugly
  duplication, but the function is going to be removed from the original
  location in a different patch:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/547518/)

Closes-Bug: #1761717

Conflicts:
	tripleo_validations/utils.py

Change-Id: I65292df11be601c39552801ed0c00f9ff7556633
(cherry picked from commit d0dc69c1eb8277f9b6789d57ed7ef632161d29a1)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Switch VLANs validation

The "Compare switch VLANs to VLANs in nic config" validation breaks when
run through Mistral. This is because the custom module used in the
validation imports functions from another custom module. Custom modules
are recognized by Ansible, but they don't necessarily live on the Python
path, so when run through Mistral the imported module cannot be found
and the validation breaks.

This patch moves the two imported functions to different locations:

- `library.network_environment.get_network_config` is refactored into a
  generic utility function in `tripleo_validations.utils`.
- `library.network_environment.open_network_environment_files` is copied
  to `library.network_environment.switch_vlans` (this is an ugly
  duplication, but the function is going to be removed from the original
  location in a different patch:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/547518/)

Closes-Bug: #1761717

Conflicts:
	tripleo_validations/utils.py

Change-Id: I65292df11be601c39552801ed0c00f9ff7556633
(cherry picked from commit d0dc69c1eb8277f9b6789d57ed7ef632161d29a1)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-24 12:57:13.000000000', 'message': 'Only run os-net-config if file has content

Instack undercloud allows the user to specify their own
os-net-config overrides file. This file currently cannot be empty
because it causes an exception in this puppet manifest.

This patch skips running os-net-config if the config file has no
data and allows the user a means to disable os-net-config from running
if they choose to do so.

Related bug: #1764507

Change-Id: I69eb812af2d653cb3eb29694ae29b57ebb2de53d
'}]
commit_message:
Only run os-net-config if file has content

Instack undercloud allows the user to specify their own
os-net-config overrides file. This file currently cannot be empty
because it causes an exception in this puppet manifest.

This patch skips running os-net-config if the config file has no
data and allows the user a means to disable os-net-config from running
if they choose to do so.

Related bug: #1764507

Change-Id: I69eb812af2d653cb3eb29694ae29b57ebb2de53d

commit_message:
Added fake tempest docker service to undercloud config

This change teaches the new containerized undercloud deploy command
to understand the `enable_tempest` configuration option, and to
correctly add the `tempest.yaml` environment file to the list of
deployment arguments.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558510/
Change-Id: I0b95bc6fd40aaa24626311182807df15f15d82ea

[{'created': '2018-04-18 18:59:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fix pylint no-value-for-parameter error

Four migration sanity tests generate a no-value-for-parameter
error.  Add a directive to ignore it as is done in some of the
alembic migration code.

Trivialfix

Change-Id: I87320c0f7157f160601a4b051734b4c5e49ea3e1

commit_message:
Fix pylint no-value-for-parameter error

Four migration sanity tests generate a no-value-for-parameter
error.  Add a directive to ignore it as is done in some of the
alembic migration code.

Trivialfix

Change-Id: I87320c0f7157f160601a4b051734b4c5e49ea3e1

commit_message:
Add manila.data.helper options to config sample

Sample config missing options from manila.data.helper.
This patch address that issue.

Change-Id: Iece4cc1b8a6ec3e6b166023f58016256172eb6e3
(cherry picked from commit 348c82124c4c34d41966f22ae94511dcdda30d9f)

Fix xstatic-check-version

Use complete path to call xstatic-check-version so that it is found.

Change-Id: Ib94fa5dce60d38929ffeaf897ba43ae78401e927

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-25 17:28:13.000000000', 'message': 'Stop using slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh

Migrate the legacy job to start using our bindep role from zuul-jobs.
This will allow openstack-infra to delete
slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh in the future.

Change-Id: I3ac3e49b1c6308398c0e7b38f9a6e7329d049f2f
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 557c1f524bb10723747590a8314e31aad70d787b)
'}]
commit_message:
Stop using slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh

Migrate the legacy job to start using our bindep role from zuul-jobs.
This will allow openstack-infra to delete
slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh in the future.

Change-Id: I3ac3e49b1c6308398c0e7b38f9a6e7329d049f2f
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 557c1f524bb10723747590a8314e31aad70d787b)

Rewrite logic for creating our temporary dirs and cleaning them up,
including process cleanup, in to python.

commit_message:
Stop using slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh

Migrate the legacy job to start using our bindep role from zuul-jobs.
This will allow openstack-infra to delete
slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh in the future.

Change-Id: I3ac3e49b1c6308398c0e7b38f9a6e7329d049f2f
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 557c1f524bb10723747590a8314e31aad70d787b)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-25 15:35:25.000000000', 'message': 'Make accept-language tests work with webob 1.8.x

webob 1.8.x has altered its processing for accept-* headers [1],
including being less accomodating of less than well-formed qvalues.
If it is unable to parse a header, rather than raising an error of
anything like that, a special class of header is created instead.
This header still responds on all the same methods as before, but with
different results. In the big picture this is a good thing (for
correcting processing for content-negotiation) but it is a bit weird
for us.

This change fixes the immediate short term problem, broken unit tests,
by fixing their bad qvalues. The new values will continue to work with
old webob. We can hope/assume that most clients will send well-formed
qvalues.

Longer term we will need to address how the nova Request object is
choosing to do best match handling on accept headers to address that
webob has deprecated (with a long warning period) methods used by the
object.

Partial-Bug: #1765748

[1] https://docs.pylonsproject.org/projects/webob/en/stable/whatsnew-1.8.html#backwards-incompatibilities

Change-Id: I2034d30cc8d9354be80d39e05b8488cb99c32ecf
'}]
commit_message:
Make accept-language tests work with webob 1.8.x

webob 1.8.x has altered its processing for accept-* headers [1],
including being less accomodating of less than well-formed qvalues.
If it is unable to parse a header, rather than raising an error of
anything like that, a special class of header is created instead.
This header still responds on all the same methods as before, but with
different results. In the big picture this is a good thing (for
correcting processing for content-negotiation) but it is a bit weird
for us.

This change fixes the immediate short term problem, broken unit tests,
by fixing their bad qvalues. The new values will continue to work with
old webob. We can hope/assume that most clients will send well-formed
qvalues.

Longer term we will need to address how the nova Request object is
choosing to do best match handling on accept headers to address that
webob has deprecated (with a long warning period) methods used by the
object.

Partial-Bug: #1765748

[1] https://docs.pylonsproject.org/projects/webob/en/stable/whatsnew-1.8.html#backwards-incompatibilities

Change-Id: I2034d30cc8d9354be80d39e05b8488cb99c32ecf

commit_message:
Relax undercloud pre-flight public VIP CIDR check

When using public TLS and there is an external network
additionally to ctlplane, users might not expect to see
a preflight fails on validating that public VIP to belong
to control plane (internal) CIDR. This is as well valid in
general, only admin VIPs should be checked against that CIDR.

Change-Id: I010489f14ade757c35d04af68c328508a3ee46d3
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Replace deprecated auth_uri by www_authenticate_uri.

auth_uri option has been depreacted in favor
of www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken
in puppet-keystone [0] and keystonemiddleware [1].

This patch adds the new option www_authenticate_uri
until the old auth_uri option is deprecated from
the rest of packages, moment in which auth_uri
references will be removed.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558344/
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: Ie3f59495b1ac43c1a35d912a2da170399652a10e
Related-Bug: #1761171

commit_message:
Clean old output before new doc builds

Remove the doc/build directory to make sure there are no stale
artifacts from past runs.

Change-Id: Ie372886867ced2ab5593bd5b293373ebc65c9179

commit_message:
WIP - Change DELETE allocations to PUT {}

In order to avoid the potential race when deleting allocations, we want
to change the call to a PUT with the consumer_generation as a required
value in the body. However, the schema changes I've tried that work for
this use case of PUT break the existing PUT calls for non-empty
allocations. So I pulled it out of the previous patch for now so that
that patch passes the tests. If someone with more JSON-schema-fu can
figure this out, I can merge this back in.

Change-Id: I4dfdb99787959977abcf4072edd109d7eacefaa2
Blueprint: add-consumer-generation

commit_message:
Provide a facility to reset the microversion

In order to allow users to explicitly assert a desired
microversion, knowing that needs can changed during a
sequence of events, a reset facility helps provide
that ability to easily assert the new default.

Change-Id: I1ebcd530edc1d83a72457c2c640455cb8dbf383f
Related-Bug: #1739440
Related-Bug: #1671145

subject: Add language links to developer.o.o front page
messages:
[{'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-04-10 11:41:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-04-10 20:06:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Looks good except no change on sitemap.xml, but before going further, we might discuss and choose the best approach so I would like to leave -1 now.

[Current problem]
- While api-quick-start document is published to https://developer.openstack.org/api-guide/quick-start/ , translated api-quick-start document is currently published to https://developer.openstack.org/ko_KR/api-quick-start/ not https://developer.openstack.org/ko_KR/api-guide/quick-start/ (example as Korean)
- For api-quick-start, original document and translated documents have different URL scheme.
- Landing pages in api-site, and language landing pages in openstack-manuals indicate old translated doc location, not new translated doc location.

[Possible solution 1]
- Encouraging this review
- Different URL scheme for original doc and translated docs still remain.
- sitemap.xml and language landing pages in openstack-manuals need to be updated

[Possible solution 2]
- Adding an exceptional case for api-quick-start by explicitly specifying  PUBLISH_DIR in https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/openstack-doc-tools/tree/bin/doc-tools-check-languages#n88
- Too many exceptional cases in here would not be a good idea I think. We might need to think how to deal with scalability later.
- openstack-doc-tools need to be released to finally fix this problem

[Possible solution 3]
- Changing original doc location from "/api-guide/quick-start/" to "api-quick-start/" by changing --target option in http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/api-site/tree/tools/build-api-quick-start.sh and changing landing pages
- I don't know histories of "/api-guide/quick-start/" naming but if changing does not affect other things, I think it is worth changing to simpler URL scheme.'}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-04-11 05:29:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-23 14:33:17.000000000', 'message': '[docs] fix invalid "rst" usage

* Fix an issue while splitting docstring to description of parameters
  and the description of the plugins itself. Method 'trip' uses the
  second line of docstring to identify the intend to cut. This logic
  bases on the fact that the first line of docstring doesn't have intend
  at all. Unfortunately, python docstring objects start with empty line
  which moves the actual first line to the second position.

* We do not use definitions in any existing plugins docstrings.
  Existance of such nodes while parsing text means that there is an
  issue with intend (redundant spaces) or missed new line between list
  title/description and actual list items. (the proper test is added)

* rst parser adds "system_message" nodes for any kind of warnings and
  errors. This behaviour can be used in our test to find all "invalid"
  things.

Change-Id: I348ccf140458b604a8cc29053d166c1610ad807d
'}, {'created': '2018-04-25 16:13:30.000000000', 'message': '[docs] fix invalid "rst" usage

commit_message:
[docs] fix invalid "rst" usage

* Fix an issue while splitting docstring to description of parameters
  and the description of the plugins itself. Method 'trip' uses the
  second line of docstring to identify the intend to cut. This logic
  bases on the fact that the first line of docstring doesn't have intend
  at all. Unfortunately, python docstring objects start with empty line
  which moves the actual first line to the second position.

* We do not use definitions in any existing plugins docstrings.
  Existance of such nodes while parsing text means that there is an
  issue with intend (redundant spaces) or missed new line between list
  title/description and actual list items. (the proper test is added)

* rst parser adds "system_message" nodes for any kind of warnings and
  errors. This behaviour can be used in our test to find all "invalid"
  things.

Change-Id: I348ccf140458b604a8cc29053d166c1610ad807d

commit_message:
Functional test: cold migrate to compute down

Resource allocation test case:
Cold migrate to a compute host being down is expected to fail.
All resource allocations should stay on the source host after the
failed cold migrate.

Change-Id: I69c765f7c9fc20f58f2c50716fc8d8fc60d6f841

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-25 12:35:56.000000000', 'message': 'Fix invalid UUIDs in test

We still have places in our test where an UUID field is initialized to
a non UUID value. This patch fixes the remaning places. A subsequent
patch will force the UUID warning in our tests to error to ensure
no new violations are introduced.

Change-Id: Ia05525058e47efb806cf8820410c8bc80eccca25
'}]
commit_message:
Fix invalid UUIDs in test

We still have places in our test where an UUID field is initialized to
a non UUID value. This patch fixes the remaning places. A subsequent
patch will force the UUID warning in our tests to error to ensure
no new violations are introduced.

Change-Id: Ia05525058e47efb806cf8820410c8bc80eccca25

commit_message:
update validation rule to look at series status on deliverable

Update the validation rule that prevents new releases on closed series
to look at the stable status of the deliverable, which can override
the value for the series.

Change-Id: I4beffa646253da7f50ddb1054b90839d881e3aa5
Story: #2001852
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
show per-deliverable stable status on releases.o.o

Add an API to Deliverable to let the sphinxext inject the series status
information, since the build conditions and working directory are
different under sphinx.

Change-Id: Id2bbdc4815564d28a5f4989bf7c74aed93e8c129
Story: #2001852
Task: #12620
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
change API to pass directory containing status file

Instead of passing the root directory, pass deliverables directory
like we do for the Deliverables class.

Change-Id: I3f6dfe8936ccbce62d0735c591694b8831604437
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
add stable-status field to deliverable files

Allow deliverables to set a stable-status value that may differ from
the series setting.

Story: #2001852
Change-Id: If5d54c317b9e1c7bc858d05bc41950eee98684fc
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-16 21:03:19.000000000', 'message': 'Remove vestigial system_metadata param from info_from_instance()

The system_metadata argument to info_from_instance() was not used
so it's removed in this change, along with all callers of that
method, which goes quite a ways.

Also, the docstring for the system_metadata argument to
notify_usage_exists() is updated since it is passed in one
specific place: rebuild with a new image. In that case, nova-api
saves off the original instance system_metadata before resetting
the system_metadata based on the new image to rebuild, which is
then passed down through nova-conductor and nova-compute where
it eventually gets used to override "image_meta" in the payload
created in info_from_instance(). It's weird, yes, and essentially
means that for legacy versioned notifications, the instance payload
will always contain the image_meta for the instance before it's
rebuilt with the new image, which is something we don't do for
versioned notifications.

Change-Id: Ia1820334dcaceca9d7fa874dd7c553fa1c5befec
Closes-Bug: #1764390
'}, {'created': '2018-04-23 15:19:39.000000000', 'message': 'Remove vestigial system_metadata param from info_from_instance()

The system_metadata argument to info_from_instance() was not used
so it's removed in this change, along with all callers of that
method, which goes quite a ways.

Also, the docstring for the system_metadata argument to
notify_usage_exists() is updated since it is passed in one
specific place: rebuild with a new image. In that case, nova-api
saves off the original instance system_metadata before resetting
the system_metadata based on the new image to rebuild, which is
then passed down through nova-conductor and nova-compute where
it eventually gets used to override "image_meta" in the payload
created in info_from_instance(). It's weird, yes, and essentially
means that for legacy versioned notifications, the instance payload
will always contain the image_meta for the instance before it's
rebuilt with the new image, which is something we don't do for
versioned notifications.

Test test_local_delete_without_info_cache is removed since it's
(1) weird in that it is doing mox-like stuff in a mock-based
test and (2) the code it was meant to test from change
Ie0bba032615d3da06cdd95b221beb37a9b8a377d no longer exists.

Change-Id: Ia1820334dcaceca9d7fa874dd7c553fa1c5befec
Closes-Bug: #1764390
'}]
commit_message:
Remove vestigial system_metadata param from info_from_instance()

The system_metadata argument to info_from_instance() was not used
so it's removed in this change, along with all callers of that
method, which goes quite a ways.

Also, the docstring for the system_metadata argument to
notify_usage_exists() is updated since it is passed in one
specific place: rebuild with a new image. In that case, nova-api
saves off the original instance system_metadata before resetting
the system_metadata based on the new image to rebuild, which is
then passed down through nova-conductor and nova-compute where
it eventually gets used to override "image_meta" in the payload
created in info_from_instance(). It's weird, yes, and essentially
means that for legacy versioned notifications, the instance payload
will always contain the image_meta for the instance before it's
rebuilt with the new image, which is something we don't do for
versioned notifications.

Test test_local_delete_without_info_cache is removed since it's
(1) weird in that it is doing mox-like stuff in a mock-based
test and (2) the code it was meant to test from change
Ie0bba032615d3da06cdd95b221beb37a9b8a377d no longer exists.

Change-Id: Ia1820334dcaceca9d7fa874dd7c553fa1c5befec
Closes-Bug: #1764390

[{'created': '2018-04-25 17:44:45.000000000', 'message': 'k8s_resource_generation: fix parameter handling

Due to assigning CA_CERTIFICATE_PATH as the CA_CERTIFICATE_PATH if a
path is not passed, if the value was unset, we'd get a null value which
would be passed to the devstack instead of the intended "".

Closes-Bug: #1765639
Change-Id: I6f51ebd0ac7879786a3827fd37fe4953e410a843
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>
'}]
commit_message:
k8s_resource_generation: fix parameter handling

Due to assigning CA_CERTIFICATE_PATH as the CA_CERTIFICATE_PATH if a
path is not passed, if the value was unset, we'd get a null value which
would be passed to the devstack instead of the intended "".

Closes-Bug: #1765639
Change-Id: I6f51ebd0ac7879786a3827fd37fe4953e410a843
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

commit_message:
add a validation rule to block new releases based on series status

We agreed at the PTG in Dublin that we would not allow releases from
branches in 'extended maintenance' mode, so that leaves 'development'
and 'maintenance'.

Story: #2001852
Change-Id: I129bdd1c6103615179a7fb7918d37fd02ba0b914
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
generate the series status table from data

Move the information about the series status into a data file and use
that to generate the table on the main page. This is the first step
toward adding deliverable-specific series status information to the
output, since we need a place to put the default values.

Because we're adding a yaml file under the deliverables directory that
is not actually a deliverable file, we have to update the validation
tool to ignore it.

Story: #2001852
Task: #14347
Change-Id: I99bd94a323b53c0dfc2cb648268e51a30321cd46
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: handle reno 2.9.0 anchor references
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-25 19:21:25.000000000', 'message': "handle reno 2.9.0 anchor references

Reno produces anchor references for sections automatically now, and
those don't have URIs set up so we want to ignore them. If we do have
another target that does have a URI we want to include that, so test
whether we have the URI before including the target info in the
output.

Change-Id: I84f1b67b3078662f72c09c0f69bd09a45a7fe83e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
handle reno 2.9.0 anchor references

Reno produces anchor references for sections automatically now, and
those don't have URIs set up so we want to ignore them. If we do have
another target that does have a URI we want to include that, so test
whether we have the URI before including the target info in the
output.

Change-Id: I84f1b67b3078662f72c09c0f69bd09a45a7fe83e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Add calico-node on k8s master node
messages:
[{'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-02-27 03:58:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11869, 'date': '2018-02-27 07:46:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-02-27 14:31:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

What is the bug? why do we need the extra mount?'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-02-28 00:59:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

@Spyros

Thanks for reviewing. I'm pretty sure it's a regression issue which introduced by 
https://review.openstack.org/524116 Because after checked out before that patch, all good. But so far, I have no idea which line causes the bug.

In kubelet log, I can see error as below:

Feb 27 02:34:35 k8scluster-5vlnnfrbuv7v-minion-0.novalocal runc[1956]: E0227 02:34:35.120650 1965 kuberuntime_manager.go:647] createPodSandbox for pod "kubernetes-dashboard-56c67b67c-hssbg_kube-system(75d345d9-1b63-11e8-9ab1-fa163ecf8983)" failed: rpc error: code = Unknown desc = rewrite resolv.conf failed for pod "kubernetes-dashboard-56c67b67c-hssbg": ResolvConfPath "/var/lib/docker/containers/bb97cd392ab3994a6e763f0cf0a1b723146b89bd92d5ba3bdaf208afe99e0120/resolv.conf" does not exist

However, the file resolv.conf does exist. So I'm wondering if there is an accessing issue for /var/lib/docker. And after added the mount, it works. I'm doing more testing about this fix. I will update the commit message to add more info after the testing. "}, {'created': '2018-03-09 08:41:38.000000000', 'message': "Fix network issue with calico

By current design, pods under kube-system will run on minion nodes. And given
now we're not running kubelet on master node, so any service needs to talk
to pods from master node will fail, such as heapster and proxy, see [1]. And
it's confirmed with calico team that the calico-node container must be running
on master node if user want to use kube-proxy, see [2]. So, the solution is
enabling kubelet on master but disallow the other pods scheduled on master
with taint/tolerations.

NOTE: Only running calico-node container on k8s master doesn't work based on
the way how Magnum deploy k8s. Because when starting the calico-node container
on master node, something are not ready yet. If start calico-node on k8s master
after all k8s nodes are ready, it works.

[1] https://github.com/projectcalico/calico/issues/1096
[2] https://docs.projectcalico.org/v3.0/getting-started/kubernetes/installation/integration#about-the-calico-components

Closes-Bug: #1751978

Change-Id: Iacd964806a28b3ca6ba3e037c60060f0957d44aa
"}, {'created': '2018-03-09 08:56:16.000000000', 'message': "Fix network issue with calico

now we're not running kubelet on master node, so any service needs to talk
to pods from master node will fail, such as heapster and proxy, see [1]. And

on master node if user want to use kube-proxy, see [2]. So, the solution is
enabling kubelet on master but disallow the other pods scheduled on master
with taint/tolerations.

k8scluster-m4ke25d5vu3q-minion-0   Ready                      <none>    1m        v1.9.3

NOTE: Only running calico-node container on k8s master doesn't work based on
the way how Magnum deploy k8s. Because when starting the calico-node container
on master node, something are not ready yet. If start calico-node on k8s master
after all k8s nodes are ready, it works.

"}, {'created': '2018-04-06 02:18:21.000000000', 'message': "Add calico-node on k8s master node

By current design, pods under kube-system will run on minion nodes. And
given now we're not running kubelet on master node, so calico-node is
not running on k8s master node. As a result, kubectl proxy is not
working to access dashboard. And it's confirmed with calico team that
the calico-node container must be running on master node if user want
to use kubectl proxy, see [1]. So, the solution is enabling kubelet
on master but disallow the other pods scheduled on master with
taint/tolerations.

Besides, this patch includes another fix about running calico on
Fedora Atomic. Because Fedora Atomic is using NetworkManager, it
manipulates the routing table for interfaces in the default network
namespace where Calico veth pairs are anchored for connections to
containers. This can interfere with the Calico agent’s ability to
route correctly. Please see more information about this at [2].

[1] https://docs.projectcalico.org/v3.0/getting-started/kubernetes/
    installation/integration#about-the-calico-components
[2] https://docs.projectcalico.org/master/usage/troubleshooting/
    #configure-networkmanager

Closes-Bug: #1751978

Change-Id: Iacd964806a28b3ca6ba3e037c60060f0957d44aa

commit_message:
Add calico-node on k8s master node

By current design, pods under kube-system will run on minion nodes. And
given now we're not running kubelet on master node, so calico-node is
not running on k8s master node. As a result, kubectl proxy is not
working to access dashboard. And it's confirmed with calico team that
the calico-node container must be running on master node if user want
to use kubectl proxy, see [1]. So, the solution is enabling kubelet
on master but disallow the other pods scheduled on master with
taint/tolerations.

Besides, this patch includes another fix about running calico on
Fedora Atomic. Because Fedora Atomic is using NetworkManager, it
manipulates the routing table for interfaces in the default network
namespace where Calico veth pairs are anchored for connections to
containers. This can interfere with the Calico agent’s ability to
route correctly. Please see more information about this at [2].

[1] https://docs.projectcalico.org/v3.0/getting-started/kubernetes/
    installation/integration#about-the-calico-components
[2] https://docs.projectcalico.org/master/usage/troubleshooting/
    #configure-networkmanager

Closes-Bug: #1751978

Change-Id: Iacd964806a28b3ca6ba3e037c60060f0957d44aa

  I0cf11da3d395749df28077427689fdafc8a6b981

commit_message:
Update docs for [keystone_authtoken] changes since Queens

The auth_uri option was deprecated and renamed in Queens:

  I0cf11da3d395749df28077427689fdafc8a6b981

The auth_uri option is also no longer necessary, at least
for the purpose of the nova install guide, since all identity
service requests can be served through the single auth_url.

This change removes auth_uri usage and also updates the
auth_url value to match what is in the keystone install
guide:

https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/queens/install/keystone-install-ubuntu.html

Change-Id: Iff332890cbe1ba5b3876874e351b09c377d8dd5d
Closes-Bug: #1765144

commit_message:
Eliminate possible insecure usage of temp file/directory

This patch is a fix for the issue B108: hardcoded_tmp_directory
found by bandit scanner.

The main reasoning for that is the need for safely creating
a temporary file or directory.

Change-Id: I4277e9196b9b707b83bb298faeccb59f07d6f10b
Related-Bug: #1759250

- If we have an initiator map, we only scan on the HBAs that are there

  are connected

commit_message:
Fix FC: Only scan connected HBAs

Current OS-Brick FC code always scans all present HBAs, which could
unintentionally add unwanted devices, for example in the following
environment:

    +-------+     +------+   +-----------------+
    | host5 +-----+      +---+ Port.A   VNX    |
    |       |     | FCSW +---+ Port.B          |
    | host6 +-----+      |   +-----------------+
    |       |     +------+
    |       |     +------+
    | host7 +-----+      |   +-----------------+
    |       |     | FCSW +---+ Port.C  XtremIO |
    | host8 +-----+      +---+ Port.D          |
    +-------+     +------+   +-----------------+

This patch limits what HBAs get scanned:

- If we have an initiator map, we only scan on the HBAs that are there
- If we are in the single WWNN for all ports case we only scan HBAs that
  are connected
- If we can't do any better we scan all HBAs with wildcards

Closes-Bug: #1765000
Change-Id: I3ba8f9683211d550727a97fc455175f2b0482886

subject: handle reno 2.9.0 anchor references
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-25 19:04:16.000000000', 'message': "handle reno 2.9.0 anchor references

Reno produces anchor references for sections automatically now, and
those don't have URIs set up so we want to ignore them. If we do have
another target that does have a URI we want to include that, so test
whether we have the URI before including the target info in the
output.

Change-Id: I84f1b67b3078662f72c09c0f69bd09a45a7fe83e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
handle reno 2.9.0 anchor references

Reno produces anchor references for sections automatically now, and
those don't have URIs set up so we want to ignore them. If we do have
another target that does have a URI we want to include that, so test
whether we have the URI before including the target info in the
output.

Change-Id: I84f1b67b3078662f72c09c0f69bd09a45a7fe83e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Set path to xstatic version checker

The xstatic version checker is copied into a directory, but then
run from a different location. The script missed referencing the
full path to the xstatic-version-checker.py script, resulting in
failures to find the file.

Change-Id: Ie591bc29d5d0d558b8fc1a087b83fdafbba982be

commit_message:
Ceph: Add metrics port to ceph-mgr service

This adds a port for ceph metrics to the ceph-mgr service to
expose an endpoint to query directly for ceph specific metrics.
This port only gets exposed when the prometheus plugin is included
in the ceph_mgr_enabled_modules: list in ceph's values

Change-Id: I5f3a5c101a87ba5b20a644fecbe808c771b9527a

This version is wrong. Adding usb host controller should happen in _get_guest_config() as there we have guest config available to change. 

_get_guest_pointer_mode() + _get_guest_usb_tablet() are simple checks for model of pointer device.

But then there are two ways and I do not know which one to choose:

1. Just add usb host controller. On x86 they are present already so one more should not do any harm.

2. Check is pointer device usb one or not and then decide to add usb host controller or not.


On the other side it looks like _get_guest_pointer_model() function works ONLY if 'usbtablet' is used..."}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-01-31 18:38:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

[{'created': '2018-01-25 19:05:05.000000000', 'message': "[dnm] Make sure that we have USB Host controller for tablet

When graphical console is enabled Nova adds 'usbtablet' as pointing
device. But it does not check is there an USB host present in VM
instance.

On x86 there is USB host present by default but not on aarch64.

Code is WIP as it crashes VM instead of running it. Will check why but
next days I have a conference to attend.

Change-Id: I69a934d188446a1aa95ab33975dbe1d6e058ebf9
Closes-bug: 1745340

"}, {'created': '2018-01-31 16:24:29.000000000', 'message': "Make sure that we have USB Host controller for tablet

When graphical console is enabled Nova adds 'usbtablet' as pointing
device. But it does not check if there an USB host controller present
in VM instance. And this is a problem on !x86 architectures.

Due to backward compatibility libvirt on x86 adds USB host controller
into default VM configuration. On other architectures they decided to
not do that leaving it to higher layers (like Nova).

So to get graphical console running on AArch64 we need to make sure that
USB host controller exists so we have few USB ports to connect our
'usbtablet' device.

Closes-bug: 1745340

Change-Id: I69a934d188446a1aa95ab33975dbe1d6e058ebf9

commit_message:
Make sure that we have usable input for graphical console

Graphical console is optional thing. But when it is enabled then it is
good to have some input devices.

On x86(-64) it is handled by PS/2 keyboard/mouse. On ppc64 we have USB
keyboard/mouse. On aarch64 we have nothing.

So make sure that we have USB Host controller available and that usb
keyboard is present. Also USB tablet (default pointer_model device) will
have a port to plug to.

Closes-bug: 1745340

Change-Id: I69a934d188446a1aa95ab33975dbe1d6e058ebf9

@Kashyap, my comment is as follows:

About the 'test_live_migration_update_graphics_xml' method,

This patch changes MIN_LIBVIRT_VERSION from (1, 2, 9) to (1, 3, 1).
If the libvirt version is higher than MIN_LIBVIRT_BLOCK_LM_WITH_VOLUMES_VERSION (1, 2, 17) (*1),
guest.migrate() method is called with 'params' that is not None. (*2)
If 'params' is not None, 'migrateToURI3' is called instead of 'migrateToURI2'.(*3)
So 'migrateToURI3' should be mocked instead of 'migrateToURI2'.

More specifically, replace 'migrateToURI2' with 'migrateToURI3' in *4,
and define expected call arguments in 'migrateToURI3' (*5).


*1: https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/88adde8bba393b8d08ce21e9e3334a76e853b2e0/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py#L233
*2: https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/88adde8bba393b8d08ce21e9e3334a76e853b2e0/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py#L7022-L7056
*3: https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/88adde8bba393b8d08ce21e9e3334a76e853b2e0/nova/virt/libvirt/guest.py#L642-L673
*4: https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/88adde8bba393b8d08ce21e9e3334a76e853b2e0/nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py#L9029
*5: https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/88adde8bba393b8d08ce21e9e3334a76e853b2e0/nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py#L9033-L9038"}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2018-04-18 07:24:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> @Kashyap, my comment is as follows:
 > 
 > About the 'test_live_migration_update_graphics_xml' method,
 > 
 > This patch changes MIN_LIBVIRT_VERSION from (1, 2, 9) to (1, 3, 1).
 > If the libvirt version is higher than MIN_LIBVIRT_BLOCK_LM_WITH_VOLUMES_VERSION
 > (1, 2, 17) (*1),
 > guest.migrate() method is called with 'params' that is not None.
 > (*2)
 > If 'params' is not None, 'migrateToURI3' is called instead of
 > 'migrateToURI2'.(*3)
 > So 'migrateToURI3' should be mocked instead of 'migrateToURI2'.

Indeed.  I've already fixed it here:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/561970/ --
tests: unit: Fix 'test_live_migration_update_graphics_xml'

Which I will squash into this change (libvirt: Bump MIN_{LIBVIRT,QEMU}_VERSION for "Rocky"), which is where it belongs.


 > More specifically, replace 'migrateToURI2' with 'migrateToURI3' in
 > *4,
 > and define expected call arguments in 'migrateToURI3' (*5).

Indeed, that's what I did: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/561970/1/nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py

[...]'}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2018-04-18 10:13:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-04-18 11:34:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-04 11:41:08.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Bump MIN_{LIBVIRT,QEMU} versions for "Rocky"

The last time we incremented versions for libvirt and QEMU was during
the "Pike" release (commit: b980df0, 11-Feb-2017); for "Queens" we
didn't do any.

The advertized NEXT_MIN_{LIBVIRT,QEMU} versions during
"Pike" release were set to: libvirt 1.3.1 and QEMU 2.5.0 -- but they
weren't actually bumped for "Queens".  So let's actually bump them for
the "Rocky" release.

(While bearing in mind to do the version increments on schedule for
future releases, as we're now "bumping" to a libvirt release that is
already more than 2 years old -- 1.3.1 was released on 17-Jan-2016.)

Change-Id: If0a091a7441f2c3269148e40ececc3696d69684c

The last time we incremented versions for libvirt and QEMU was during
the "Pike" release (commit: b980df0, 11-Feb-2017); for "Queens" we
didn't do any.

The advertized NEXT_MIN_{LIBVIRT,QEMU} versions during
"Pike" release were set to: libvirt 1.3.1 and QEMU 2.5.0 -- but they
weren't actually bumped for "Queens".  So let's actually bump them for
the "Rocky" release.  (While bearing in mind to do the version
increments on schedule for future releases, as we're now "bumping" to a
libvirt release that is already more than 2 years old -- 1.3.1 was
released on 17-Jan-2016.)

Also, fix the resulting fallout from unit tests.  While at it, use the
FAKE_{LIBVIRT, QEMU}_VERSION constants in tests, instead of hard-coding
versions.

Change-Id: If0a091a7441f2c3269148e40ececc3696d69684c

the "Pike" release (commit: b980df0, 11-Feb-2017); for "Queens" we
didn't do any.

The advertized NEXT_MIN_{LIBVIRT,QEMU} versions during
"Pike" release were set to: libvirt 1.3.1 and QEMU 2.5.0 -- but they
weren't actually bumped for "Queens".  So let's actually bump them for
the "Rocky" release.  (While bearing in mind to do the version
increments on schedule for future releases, as we're now "bumping" to a
libvirt release that is already more than 2 years old -- 1.3.1 was
released on 17-Jan-2016.)

Also, fix the resulting fallout from unit tests.  While at it, use the
FAKE_{LIBVIRT, QEMU}_VERSION constants in tests, instead of hard-coding
versions.

Change-Id: If0a091a7441f2c3269148e40ececc3696d69684c

'}, {'created': '2018-04-18 10:13:50.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Bump MIN_{LIBVIRT,QEMU}_VERSION for "Rocky"

The last time we incremented versions for libvirt and QEMU was during
the "Pike" release (commit: b980df0, 11-Feb-2017); for "Queens" we
didn't do any.

The advertized NEXT_MIN_{LIBVIRT,QEMU} versions during
"Pike" release were set to: libvirt 1.3.1 and QEMU 2.5.0 -- but they

increments on schedule for future releases, as we're now "bumping" to a

released on 17-Jan-2016.)

Fix the affected functional tests.  And where applicable, use the
FAKE_{LIBVIRT, QEMU}_VERSION constants in tests, instead of hard-coding
versions.

Also fix the following live migration unit tests in the libvirt driver:

  - test_live_migration_update_graphics_xml
  - test_live_migration_update_serial_console_xml
  - test_live_migration_with_valid_target_connect_addr
  - test_live_migration_raises_exception

In above tests the following, two main changes were made:

  - "Mock" the migrateToURI3() API instead of migrateToURI2() -- because
    with the libvirt version bump, Nova's guest.migrate() method will
    now call libvirt's newer API migrateToURI3() with 'params' dict.  So
    adjust the tests accordingly.

  - Replace the usage of "Mox" with "Mock" in relevant tests.  (I know
    we should try to stick to the sensible rule of "one logical change
    per patch".  But the tests were already failing and we are
    systematically removing the usage of Mox in Nova source tree anyway.
    On that grounds, this seems reasonable.)

Change-Id: If0a091a7441f2c3269148e40ececc3696d69684c
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>

commit_message:
libvirt: Bump MIN_{LIBVIRT,QEMU}_VERSION for "Rocky"

The last time we incremented versions for libvirt and QEMU was during
the "Pike" release (commit: b980df0, 11-Feb-2017); for "Queens" we
didn't do any.

The advertized NEXT_MIN_{LIBVIRT,QEMU} versions during
"Pike" release were set to: libvirt 1.3.1 and QEMU 2.5.0 -- but they
weren't actually bumped for "Queens".  So let's actually bump them for
the "Rocky" release.

Fix the affected functional tests.  And where applicable, use the
FAKE_{LIBVIRT, QEMU}_VERSION constants in tests, instead of hard-coding
versions.

Also fix the following live migration unit tests in the libvirt driver:

  - test_live_migration_update_graphics_xml
  - test_live_migration_update_serial_console_xml
  - test_live_migration_with_valid_target_connect_addr
  - test_live_migration_raises_exception

In above tests the following, two main changes were made:

  - "Mock" the migrateToURI3() API instead of migrateToURI2() -- because
    with the libvirt version bump, Nova's guest.migrate() method will
    now call libvirt's newer API migrateToURI3() with 'params' dict.  So
    adjust the tests accordingly.

  - Replace the usage of "Mox" with "Mock" in relevant tests.  (I know
    we should try to stick to the sensible rule of "one logical change
    per patch".  But the tests were already failing and we are
    systematically removing the usage of Mox in Nova source tree anyway.
    On that grounds, this seems reasonable.)

Also drop the following version constants, which are no longer needed
and adjust / remove corresponding unit tests:

  - MIN_{LIBVIRT_KVM,QEMU}_S390_VERSION
  - MIN_LIBVIRT_KVM_PPC64_VERSION
  - Drop MIN_LIBVIRT_VIRTUOZZO_VERSION

Note that subsequent patches will handle clean up of remaining (now no
longer needed) version constants and compatibility code.

Change-Id: If0a091a7441f2c3269148e40ececc3696d69684c
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>

messages:
[{'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-04-25 13:35:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-04-25 13:38:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-25 13:35:44.000000000', 'message': 'Change default loopingcall interval for tests

There has been a change in oslo.service [1] that changes the logic on
how loopingcall works. The underlying change has a limitation that does
not allow an interval to be equal to 0, as it breaks the implementation.

This patch raises the default interval to 0.1.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/558206/

Change-Id: I7baddfae00f435de9d0e5e4880319f35011e104d
'}]
commit_message:
Change default loopingcall interval for tests

There has been a change in oslo.service [1] that changes the logic on
how loopingcall works. The underlying change has a limitation that does
not allow an interval to be equal to 0, as it breaks the implementation.

This patch raises the default interval to 0.1.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/558206/

Change-Id: I7baddfae00f435de9d0e5e4880319f35011e104d

commit_message:
Import ansible-role-container-registry

This role has to replace the puppet code that used to deploy and
configure Docker and Docker Registry.
We aim to make a generic role that can be re-used by the community.

Change-Id: Ie23e36bfa8451275e460100ab4776bf5aa8efa54
Needed-By: Ife3934bbb2686fca94eb28b5591c36567b90b58c

commit_message:
Add version check for ovs >= 2.8 before applying perm changes

We are changing permissions for ovs, and creating a service
file to modify folder permissions. But that is only needed if
ovs >= 2.8 . So add a version check before applying that.

Change-Id: Ib4fd410fb85019638535d6a293bdb9ccb476d7a4
(cherry picked from commit 2c677c22f0067fce6acec85d8c98c1ff0499a65c)

commit_message:
Add version check for ovs >= 2.8 before applying perm changes

We are changing permissions for ovs, and creating a service
file to modify folder permissions. But that is only needed if
ovs >= 2.8 . So add a version check before applying that.

commit_message:
Change ovs user and fix permissions on ovs upgrade

When upgrading to latest ovs, package needs to run with ovs user,
and also the affected folders need to change their perms. Change
the config file for it, and initially do a perm change. Also
create a one-time service file that will run after reboot, to be
sure that all the remaining folders have changed their perms
properly.

Change-Id: Iab8371161ec4ccb7f9541448e51bb0f647e43798
Related-Bug: #1759982

commit_message:
Fix the events db size validation

To lookup the enable_telemetry value from the undercloud.conf file the task
needs the `become: true` flag.

Change-Id: Ic3d5313df921e1da2f6921eb5810077dd97bee69

commit_message:
Change ovs user and fix permissions on ovs upgrade

When upgrading to latest ovs, package needs to run with
ovs user, and also the affected folders need to change their perms.
Change the config file for it, and initially do a perm change. Also
create a one-time service file that will run after reboot, to be
sure that all the remaining folders have changed their perms
properly.

Related-Bug: #1759982
Change-Id: I0e103cb19a7bbaf951d233acfcb51086e57cf264
(cherry picked from commit 57c0018c5031b33b94f39bb7e89ad81b2b89274c)

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2018-04-20 11:54:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

gonna update this after quick sanity check with dciabrin via #tripleo

seems like a sane thing to do...



14:46 < marios> dciabrin_: not afaik. the error is coming from this https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560408/6/docker/services/pacemaker/cinder-volume.yaml@328
14:47 < marios> dciabrin_: the conditionals hold, since on the previous run the kolla config was created and so             - cinder_volume_containerized|bool
14:48 < marios> is true (I pasted that in the comment i left in the commit message
14:48 < dciabrin_> marios, oh..... I see so config might have been generated and the resource might not have been created yet
14:48 < marios> dciabrin_: right
14:48 < dciabrin_> got it
14:49 < marios> dciabrin_: i think thats what happened. as i wrote in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/563073/1//COMMIT_MSG its a rerun
14:49 < marios> dciabrin_: i think it could happen if some later upgrade task fails too for instance (then the containerization didn't happen, maybe the kolla config did, 
                like here)
14:49 < dciabrin_> yeah I tried to think about how that could happen, but you're right this has to be that
14:49 < marios> dciabrin_: well i'm going to add th eother services there so i can apply and rerun see what happens... 
14:50 < dciabrin_> marios, so the idea is "if there is already a bundle resource, do the whole dance, otherwise do nothing"?
14:51 < marios> dciabrin_: yeah, i mean, the rest of the tasks (like fetch & retag the container image) will still work OK afaics
14:52 < marios> dciabrin_: since these are the only things directly invoking the pcs resource
14:52 < dciabrin_> right.
14:52 < dciabrin_> marios, I like it. good catch!
14:52 < marios> dciabrin_: ack, might need some further thought but thanks for initial sanity check
14:52 < marios> dciabrin_: i'll add the services lets see what others think of it too 
14:53 < marios> dciabrin_: thanks
14:53 < marios> dciabrin_: (in a bit though i have a call starting in few mins)
14:53 < dciabrin_> marios, ack'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2018-04-20 15:28:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2018-04-20 15:41:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Yep, I'm late on that one. Let me launch a containerized -> containerized upgrade with only pacemaker services. I'll do the +1 probably tonight or tomorrow morning :)"}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2018-04-23 23:38:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

So I tested on a HA overcloud with only main HA services (galera, rabbitmq, redis, haproxy);
I prepare a full image upgrade and ran the with "openstack overcloud upgrade run --nodes Controller --playbook upgrade_steps_playbook.yaml" 

The upgrade worked fine:
u'PLAY RECAP *********************************************************************',
 u'192.168.24.15              : ok=203  changed=80   unreachable=0    failed=0   ',
 u'192.168.24.17              : ok=222  changed=98   unreachable=0    failed=0   ',
 u'192.168.24.7               : ok=203  changed=80   unreachable=0    failed=0   ',
 u'']
All services were upgraded and running.

I then ran a second time to check whether upgrade with same image was working, and it succeeded as well:
 u'PLAY RECAP *********************************************************************',

commit_message:
Make pcs resource bundle image name update tolerant of rerun

The parent review at Ic87a66753b104b9f15db70fdccbd66d88cef94df
allows us to update the name for pcs resource bundle resources
if this is changed as part of the upgrade configuration.

If the upgrade is interrupted the target pacemaker resource bundle
may not even have been created yet. This groups stop/update/start
the bundle resource and adds a new conditional to check if the
cluster resource exists before trying to update the container
image being used. Otherwise a re-run of the upgrade tasks may
fail if the cluster resource doesn't exist.

Related-Bug: 1763001
Change-Id: Ifc6f78d73bc71a5b5edfadfbfacaa3560fe7c2df

commit_message:
No-op Mistral workflow resources for update/upgrade/ffwd

So far we haven't been disabling workflows for update/upgrade. We
should disable them by default as they could have the potential to
disrupt the update/upgrade/ffwd procedure.

The main example of a thing we deploy via the workflow resources is
Ceph. We decided no-opping ceph-ansible for the main
update/upgrade/ffwd upgrade steps is the safest path forward and we'll
update/upgrade Ceph it after the main procedure is finished.

Change-Id: I34c7213ab7b70963ad2e50f7633b665fad70bde5
(cherry picked from commit 19be98ba07d9c8881d67a359b9c1a424f824e2ac)

commit_message:
Do not pass ceph_release to ceph-ansible

Hardcoding the Ceph version to use in the templates causes issues in
some generic tasks during upgrade, when the cluster has nodes in
mixed state.

Closes-Bug: 1766502
Change-Id: I20bfd46c1db41e2d2ebd3f810591cabf27f2e664

Deprecate support for workflow_tasks in Ceph services.

With the migration to external_deploy_tasks, we can remove support
for workflow_tasks in the Ceph services.

Change-Id: Ib7851e02424d4adb1490e8ed36327dc4a573c44f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-25 18:00:39.000000000', 'message': 'revist lifecycle_hook logic

1. use one "Message" object to sink event
2. replace the node_id whith physical_id which is the actual
resource id in the event message
3. check both node status and physical id before send event
4. remove the actions that can be executed immediately from "child"
to reduce DB interactions

Change-Id: Ifa55a5a4ce6545b96a74d27924ed537b50a1bcd4
'}]
commit_message:
revist lifecycle_hook logic

1. use one "Message" object to sink event
2. replace the node_id whith physical_id which is the actual
resource id in the event message
3. check both node status and physical id before send event
4. remove the actions that can be executed immediately from "child"
to reduce DB interactions

Change-Id: Ifa55a5a4ce6545b96a74d27924ed537b50a1bcd4

commit_message:
Validate that there should not be XFS volumes with ftype=0

If  we have XFS partitions formatted with ftype=0,
the upgrades will fail because ftype=0 is incompatible
with the docker overlayfs driver.

Related-Bug: 1765121
Change-Id: I895fc83d148523c283664080b7b1bf75d53d9edb

commit_message:
Firewall: NOT persist ephemetal ironic-inspector rules

When Ironic Inspector is configured to use the iptables
pxe_filter driver it uses ephemeral firewall rules. This
change ensures that these rules are not persisted.

Ironic Inspector iptables filter driver does not set
comments on it's rules. This patch use the string:
'-m comment --comment' to ensure rules created by
puppet-tripleo firewall is not accidentally removed from
the persisted firewall rules.

Change-Id: Ic90804db8dd74fce78169d9857a150d5ebf40cbb
Related-Bug: #1765700
(cherry picked from commit 94ca328e5d309a5617043b2944e65df79271e0cd)

commit_message:
Ceph: Pool management update

This PS updates the pool management job to change PG params as
required post creation if the osd count increases.

Change-Id: Ib4ed26e6b5be8e7c0f3cafaffde8c5b6a6c07cb2

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I1113b40d6cbf856342ab58b205fb518dbc27885e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Drop MIN_LIBVIRT_SET_ADMIN_PASSWD

The updated minimum required libvirt (1.3.1) and QEMU (2.5.0) for
"Rocky" matches this now, so we can drop the compatibility code.

Also remove / fix relevant unit tests.

Change-Id: Ib298817016515538adf7be46af79e98bcd5df41f
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Stop using slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh

Migrate the legacy job to start using our bindep role from zuul-jobs.
This will allow openstack-infra to delete
slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh in the future.

Change-Id: If4a5b5c1d85e1491c1544378479c0fc82ad2af03

commit_message:
Add a package for freezer

freezer need the trickle package  to limit the traffic speed

refer to
https://github.com/openstack/freezer/blob/ebc4e8a57c6b0f8670f075d646c2665d855ee10d/freezer/common/config.py#L692

Change-Id: I5d1c26a40ed15a1a41db057b4d68ebc51b967b97

commit_message:
Stop using slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh

Migrate the legacy job to start using our bindep role from zuul-jobs.
This will allow openstack-infra to delete
slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh in the future.

Change-Id: Ie3437d26fd6dfa884c86e18d69c1b1398d821dbe
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Stop using slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh

Migrate the legacy job to start using our bindep role from zuul-jobs.
This will allow openstack-infra to delete
slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh in the future.

Change-Id: I3ac3e49b1c6308398c0e7b38f9a6e7329d049f2f
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Don't failover amphora with LB in PENDING_*

This patch updates the health manager to update the amphora_health timestamp
even if the listener count does not match if the load balancer is in PENDING_*
provisioning status. This will stop failovers for occuring on load balancers
being updated or deleted.

Change-Id: I7d483d764bd841c6977afa0bcf3227e02c573b91
Co-Authored-By: Adam Harwell <flux.adam@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 5daea955efa75e4256b98697f9e17f1e9c581e13)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-17 11:45:24.000000000', 'message': "fix blueprint related to the spec

It's important to note that, there are some differents between the
blueprint proposed and the spec accepted:

- It has been indicated in the approved spec that the option
  introduced will not be 'CONF.overhead_pin_set' but
  'CONF.cpu_share_set'.

- Also instead of introducing a new policy HOST for
  hw:emulator_threads_policy it has been indicated in the approved
  spec that, the already defined policy SHARE in conjuncture with
  CONF.cpu_share_set will make the guests emulator threads to float on
  the whole set of pCPUs defined by CONF.cpu_share_set.

Change-Id: Ia6a7be7e3abb0cd27752fdef3721a748848b3747
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>

commit_message:
fix blueprint related to the spec overhead-pin-set

It's important to note that, there are some differents between the
blueprint proposed and the spec accepted:

- It has been indicated in the approved spec that the option
  introduced will not be 'CONF.overhead_pin_set' but
  'CONF.cpu_shared_set'.

- Also instead of introducing a new policy HOST for
  hw:emulator_threads_policy it has been indicated in the approved
  spec that, the already defined policy SHARE in conjuncture with
  CONF.cpu_shared_set will make the guests emulator threads to float
  on the whole set of pCPUs defined by CONF.cpu_shared_set.

Related-to: bp overhead-pin-set
Change-Id: Ia6a7be7e3abb0cd27752fdef3721a748848b3747
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Expose version status in EndpointData

We collect the status when doing discovery, but it's not exposed
anywhere to the use when they look at the EndpointData for an endpoint.

Add a function to normalize the statuses and then add normalized status
to the EndpointData object.

Change-Id: Icf855d7892335b093c1083cd0106946d8911010d

The idempotence of the role doesn't really work properly
with the modern get-pip.py script.

Instead of porting [1] and [2] back along with other patches
which may have merged in master but are not in the stable
branch but may be necessary, we disable the idempotence check
instead.

This way we keep the stable branch stable, but ensure
idempotence properly from Rocky onwards.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/562243
[2] https://review.openstack.org/562188

Change-Id: Iaf0ef428f9c8a845e779770fb54fe62495326c4a
"}]
commit_message:
Disable idempotence test

The idempotence of the role doesn't really work properly
with the modern get-pip.py script.

Instead of porting [1] and [2] back along with other patches
which may have merged in master but are not in the stable
branch but may be necessary, we disable the idempotence check
instead.

This way we keep the stable branch stable, but ensure
idempotence properly from Rocky onwards.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/562243
[2] https://review.openstack.org/562188

Change-Id: Iaf0ef428f9c8a845e779770fb54fe62495326c4a

commit_message:
Use items per page setting on Angular tables

Make NG table get page size from the items per page setting
instead of a fixed number which is 20.

The styling of the pagination control is the same as the
django table with the prev and next links.

Co-Authored-By: Liuqing Jing <jing.liuqing@99cloud.net>
Co-Authored-By: Vladislav Kuzmin <vkuzmin@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: Ie5307e335ca3251a342d370e7277fe16067f7949
Closes-Bug: #1647677
(cherry picked from commit c58e5b8779b296d57e30bd547e46322b3d1e8d99)

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

* If state was changed in another transaction the retrying of update
statements doesn't make sense
* Fix formatting bug

Change-Id: Ibcaf088f5cbfa317a3364d51762027dda09368f7
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>
"}, {'created': '2018-04-20 21:31:02.000000000', 'message': "Minor `update_on_match` improvement:

If state was changed in another transaction the retrying of update
statements doesn't make sense

Change-Id: Ibcaf088f5cbfa317a3364d51762027dda09368f7
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>
"}, {'created': '2018-04-23 16:23:56.000000000', 'message': 'Minor `update_on_match` improvement

The `update_on_match` function invokes the UPDATE statement
and check for "success" one or more times, up to a maximum of that
passed as attempts. By default attempts value is 3 in oslo_db. This fix
changes value of attempts for out cases.

Change-Id: Ibcaf088f5cbfa317a3364d51762027dda09368f7
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>
'}]
commit_message:
Minor `update_on_match` improvement

The `update_on_match` function invokes the UPDATE statement
and check for "success" one or more times, up to a maximum of that
passed as attempts. By default attempts value is 3 in oslo_db. This fix
changes value of attempts for out cases.

Change-Id: Ibcaf088f5cbfa317a3364d51762027dda09368f7
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>

[{'account_id': 12736, 'date': '2016-10-09 02:34:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-10-09 02:38:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

- gate-cinder-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/43/384143/1/check/gate-cinder-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial/e093cf1//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 2m 02s
