The focus for Ocata is bug fixes and stability with only finishing features that were already in progress. The soonest this will be allowed in is the Pike release, so please move to the specs/pike folder.'}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2018-01-27 06:10:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2018-01-27 06:11:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Move this spec into rocky folder'}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2018-01-27 06:25:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2018-01-29 03:18:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2018-01-29 06:15:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 11224, 'date': '2018-01-29 06:59:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-01-29 19:22:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

Already available in Glance and Nova - I think this would be a good thing to add to Cinder in Rocky.'}, {'account_id': 7012, 'date': '2018-01-29 19:36:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

First off, thank you for working on adding this functionality to Cinder!  I think it is a valuable feature.

I had a few suggestions for improvements to the spec.

One thing that is missing from this specification is supporting the concept of "trusted certificates" -- a feature that is in the process of being added to Nova, but is not currently planned for Glance.

See the Queens specification for Nova for trusted certificates at: http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/queens/approved/nova-validate-certificates.html and the related patches at: https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:bp/nova-validate-certificates+(status:open+OR+status:merged) for additional details. Note that the trusted certificates functionality has already been added to cursive.

I would also recommend adding a related test to the barbican-tempest-plugin (see https://github.com/openstack/barbican-tempest-plugin/blob/master/barbican_tempest_plugin/tests/scenario/test_image_signing.py for current image signing tests).'}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2018-02-01 03:40:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2018-02-01 03:41:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> First off, thank you for working on adding this functionality to
 > Cinder!  I think it is a valuable feature.
 > 
 > I had a few suggestions for improvements to the spec.
 > 
 > One thing that is missing from this specification is supporting the
 > concept of "trusted certificates" -- a feature that is in the
 > process of being added to Nova, but is not currently planned for
 > Glance.
 > 
 > See the Queens specification for Nova for trusted certificates at:
 > http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/queens/approved/nova-validate-certificates.html
 > and the related patches at: https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:bp/nova-validate-certificates+(status:open+OR+status:merged)
 > for additional details. Note that the trusted certificates
 > functionality has already been added to cursive.
 > 
 > I would also recommend adding a related test to the
 > barbican-tempest-plugin (see https://github.com/openstack/barbican-tempest-plugin/blob/master/barbican_tempest_plugin/tests/scenario/test_image_signing.py
 > for current image signing tests).

Thanks, I really appreciate it!'}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2018-02-01 06:04:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Published edit on patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2018-02-12 16:12:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

How does this interact with glance images stored in the cinder volume image cache?

Presumably it would have to validate the image again even if it is reading it from the Cinder cache.  This needs to be documented here as it has implications for both security and performance.


I didn't see what the I/O path actually is when verifying the image data.  Is it reading it from a temp file?  What about drivers that don't use a temp file for the image download, etc.?  Where is the verification actually done?"}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2018-02-13 02:50:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2018-02-13 02:51:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)

Thanks, eric!'}, {'account_id': 1207, 'date': '2018-03-07 15:32:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

Without a 'strict' option that only allows signed images, this is providing little more than a checksum; an attacker with access enough to modify an image generally has enough access to turn it into an unsigned image and avoid all to the checks."}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2018-03-09 00:33:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(10 comments)

Have number of in-line nits and I agree with Duncan's assessment."}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2018-03-14 09:03:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2018-03-14 09:04:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Address Duncan's and Jay's comments."}, {'account_id': 1207, 'date': '2018-03-14 14:42:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-03-14 14:48:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2

(5 comments)

Some nits pointed out inline, but overall I think this looks good and I would like to see us go forward with it.'}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2018-03-14 15:29:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Thank you for addressing the optional/required issues.  I think this is good to go if we can get the nits addressed.  This does become part of our documentation so it is important to address those.

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2018-03-15 07:31:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2018-03-15 07:31:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

Address Sean and Jay's comments"}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2018-03-15 14:02:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2

Thanks for addressing the comments.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-03-15 14:14:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1207, 'date': '2018-03-15 15:06:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2018-03-15 15:41:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

Should we add a field to volume_image_metadata for the volume, indicating whether the image had a signature verified during creation, so that the user can tell that this happened?  (Since the user supplies the signature to Glance in the first place.)'}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2018-03-16 02:45:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2018-03-16 02:46:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

> Should we add a field to volume_image_metadata for the volume,
 > indicating whether the image had a signature verified during
 > creation, so that the user can tell that this happened?  (Since the
 > user supplies the signature to Glance in the first place.)

Thanks, I added this in the spec, but I am not sure whether it's enough for end user if we only supply True/False in the metadata."}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2018-03-16 15:05:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2

Still looks good.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-03-17 23:05:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1207, 'date': '2018-03-17 23:11:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2018-03-20 12:52:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

How would the proposed strict mode work on the Ceph driver, where we rely on backend transfer between a glance and a cinder ceph store?  Cinder does not have a copy of the data to validate in this case.  Adding one would be a serious performance impact.'}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2018-03-22 11:11:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2018-03-22 11:18:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

Thanks, Eric, based on my understanding of the PTG discussion, we still can't cover some of the approaches even with strict mode, for instance when volume is created by driver via clone_image method. commit_message:
Support image signature verification

Adds a spec for supporting image signature verification.

Cinder currently does not support signature validation of downloaded
signed images. Equipping Cinder with the ability to validate image
signatures will provide end users with stronger assurances of the
integrity of the image data they are using to create volumes.
This change will use the same data model for image metadata as the
accompanying functionality in Glance, which will allow the end user
to sign images and verify these image signatures upon upload.

blueprint cinder-support-image-signing

Change-Id: If9eb0380663f20e2ea5821247b54ca6006c47beb

commit_message:
Follow the new PTI for document build

For compliance with the Project Testing Interface as described in:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

Remove the '[build_sphinx]' section as described in:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128594.html

Change-Id: Ibd6c6e9cca238821099ce190784d077ffe4c2dee

commit_message:
Make hidden stack tag configurable

the current hardcoded value is different from the default one in Heat
and is mainly applicable to a Heat deployed with devstack-gate on CI.

To make this test pass against an OpenStack cloud in a general case
the tag that must be considered by the test to be hidden must be
configurable.

Change-Id: I51e03ee919536b5946271f2f9abc78e382dd00cb
Closes-Bug: #1757117

messages: [{'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-04-25 14:48:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-04-25 14:48:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3099, 'date': '2018-04-25 14:49:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-25 14:48:17.000000000', 'message': 'Disable VEXXHOST in Nodepool

Volume quota support is currently not implemented as well as no
cleaning up of stale volumes which can result in the volume
quotas to be hit and then Nodepool will endlessly create VMs
and destroy them non-stop as they constantly go to ERROR state.

Change-Id: I845d34082d14b2b311242aac011ba047b5eae364
'}]
commit_message:
Disable VEXXHOST in Nodepool

Volume quota support is currently not implemented as well as no
cleaning up of stale volumes which can result in the volume
quotas to be hit and then Nodepool will endlessly create VMs
and destroy them non-stop as they constantly go to ERROR state.

Change-Id: I845d34082d14b2b311242aac011ba047b5eae364

'}, {'created': '2017-01-05 21:14:06.000000000', 'message': "firewall: add IPv6 support

This patch adds support for ip6tables rules in TripleO, in a intuitive
and flexible fashion.

1) Default firewal rules 'source' parameter to undef.
   It was 0.0.0.0/0 before but now undef, so we don't need complex logic to
   support ipv6 rules. undef will create empty source, which is the same as
   0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0.

2) Automatically convert icmp rules to ipv6-icmp for ipv6 rules.

3) Automatically create IPv6 rules like it's for IPv4.

4) Only create rules that can be created, depending on
   source/destination ip version.

This patch should be backward compatible and adds a layer of security
for IPv6 deployments. If previous deployments were manually creating
Ipv6 rules, it's possible that this patch will override them. Our
framework is able to configure any rule, so it shouldn't be a problem
for upgrades.

commit_message:
firewall: add IPv6 support

This patch adds support for ip6tables rules in TripleO, in a intuitive
and flexible fashion.

1) Default firewal rules 'source' parameter to undef.
   It was 0.0.0.0/0 before but now undef, so we don't need complex logic to
   support ipv6 rules. undef will create empty source, which is the same as
   0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0.

2) Automatically convert icmp rules to ipv6-icmp for ipv6 rules.

3) Automatically create IPv6 rules like it's for IPv4.

4) Only create rules that can be created, depending on
   source/destination ip version.

This patch should be backward compatible and adds a layer of security
for IPv6 deployments. If previous deployments were manually creating
Ipv6 rules, it's possible that this patch will override them. Our
framework is able to configure any rule, so it shouldn't be a problem
for upgrades.

Co-Authored-By: Ben Nemec <bnemec@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1654050
Change-Id: I98a00a9ae265d3e5854632e749cc8c3a1647298c

commit_message:
firewall: add IPv6 support

This patch adds support for ip6tables rules in TripleO, in a intuitive
and flexible fashion.

1) Default firewal rules 'source' parameter to undef.
   It was 0.0.0.0/0 before but now undef, so we don't need complex logic to
   support ipv6 rules. undef will create empty source, which is the same as
   0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0.

2) Automatically convert icmp rules to ipv6-icmp for ipv6 rules.

3) Automatically create IPv6 rules like it's for IPv4.

4) Only create rules that can be created, depending on
   source/destination ip version.

This patch should be backward compatible and adds a layer of security
for IPv6 deployments. If previous deployments were manually creating
Ipv6 rules, it's possible that this patch will override them. Our
framework is able to configure any rule, so it shouldn't be a problem
for upgrades.

Co-Authored-By: Ben Nemec <bnemec@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1654050
Change-Id: I98a00a9ae265d3e5854632e749cc8c3a1647298c
(cherry picked from commit 8c990738900cd74c2c5c046435517393d1afb92e)

commit_message:
firewall: add IPv6 support

This patch adds support for ip6tables rules in TripleO, in a intuitive
and flexible fashion.

1) Default firewal rules 'source' parameter to undef.
   It was 0.0.0.0/0 before but now undef, so we don't need complex logic to
   support ipv6 rules. undef will create empty source, which is the same as
   0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0.

2) Automatically convert icmp rules to ipv6-icmp for ipv6 rules.

3) Automatically create IPv6 rules like it's for IPv4.

4) Only create rules that can be created, depending on
   source/destination ip version.

This patch should be backward compatible and adds a layer of security
for IPv6 deployments. If previous deployments were manually creating
Ipv6 rules, it's possible that this patch will override them. Our
framework is able to configure any rule, so it shouldn't be a problem
for upgrades.

Co-Authored-By: Ben Nemec <bnemec@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1654050
Change-Id: I98a00a9ae265d3e5854632e749cc8c3a1647298c
(cherry picked from commit 8c990738900cd74c2c5c046435517393d1afb92e)

commit_message:
Cinder REST API test: Make list_extensions test work properly

Previously cinder list_extensions test was disabled (by starting
the test name with an underscore) and REST API for cinder extensions
did not work properly.

This commit fixes the REST API and corresponding unit test.
To make it easy to write the test, test data for list_extensions
response of cinder v2 API is also added.

Related-Bug: #1752917
Change-Id: I5ac014d62462529e186e9dde3842c6a8a629f1c4

subject: Make db migration idempotent
messages:
[{'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2018-04-20 20:05:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-04-20 20:32:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Morgan is more familiar with this area of the code than I am. I want to make sure we walk through things with him before moving further with this.

In the event we do chose to pursue this, it will need tests.'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-04-21 00:15:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2018-04-23 15:20:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2018-04-23 22:37:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

The Idempotency should not be added in the upstream/main repo, but merely in the downstream and stable repos.  Otherwise, it is too much complexity.  When adding in a stable backport, that is the point at which you submit a change to the later DB migration to ensure it runs IFF it had run before.'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-04-23 22:40:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I'm inclined to say that this is not really something we should be concerned with upstream. Honestly, I don't want to set the precident that if someone backports a migration (really, don't do this) without taking into account we write the migrations to be run exactly once (with limited exceptions that we backport upstream) we aren't digging the vendor out.

This could have also been accomplished by naming the index differently preventing an index conflict.

In short, I am not inclined to set precedent here where we make changes to migrations due to someone externally backporting.

I did speak with Harry Rybacki and discussed a possible SPEC to make all migrations idempotent, but before we accept this the team needs to have a bit more discussion. We can look into the temperature of changing how we handle migrations at the next Keystone Weekly meeting."}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2018-04-25 15:12:25.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Seems folks do not want to backport data migrations.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-20 20:05:43.000000000', 'message': 'Make db migration idempotent

The migration to add a default project id index was
not idempotent resulting in migration errors on upgrade
when backported.

Change-Id: I35096fe241e767c3c735ffd26b5a7700cf792f78
Closes-Bug: 1765830
'}]
commit_message:
Make db migration idempotent

The migration to add a default project id index was
not idempotent resulting in migration errors on upgrade
when backported.

Change-Id: I35096fe241e767c3c735ffd26b5a7700cf792f78
Closes-Bug: 1765830

commit_message:
Introduce filters on listing containers

This PS add supports the following filters which
are supported by server side:
 ['name', 'image', 'project_id', 'user_id',
  'memory', 'host', 'task_state', 'status',
  'auto_remove']
Closes-Bug:#1757152

Change-Id: I7983954c1bec56275f55e44e62930b79e8b695a1

cleanly.

commit_message:
Introduce Ceph upgrade environments

These will disable OS::TripleO::DeploymentSteps on prepare, to allow
for a Heat stack update without triggering a puppet apply and then
restore the Heat resource and the Ceph ansible playbook on converge.

Change-Id: Ie765b429c4cb36d9dd616584cc1d4f45184fa1b8
(cherry picked from commit 6730accc63e059e92f33f1741132d83e3495f195)

commit_message:
Update the database connection for keystone

1. the pymysql is needed for the current release[0]
2. it should use keystone_database_address rather than
keystone_service_ip, because they may different.

[0]: https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/roles/keystone/templates/keystone.conf.j2#L22

Change-Id: I4e164d41a0071be0cac23c295709397f1e7204ed

If someone has time to work on that now, then great. My hope was to correct the broken imported job so that the OpenStackID maintainers can resume relying on the deployment automation which uses these tarballs. commit_message:
Further fix laravel branch and master publish jobs

When pulling tarball artifacts from the job node in
legacy-laravel-openstackid-release-branch and -master, first make
sure the destination directory on the executor exists.

Change-Id: I08be39dfd4931e7413482550b95b3709f0b28776

commit_message:
dev mode: Add support for aodh

Provide support fot kolla dev mode in aodh. When
'kolla_dev_mode' or 'aodh_dev_mode' variables are
enabled, source code of aodh project is cloned
and bindmounted.

Partially implements: blueprint mount-sources
Co-Authored-By: wu.chunyang <wu.chunyang@99cloud.net>

Change-Id: I1235013ab2ff887c4311126cbff7367775f66347

commit_message:
Only zero out stats at the start of a shard cycle

Otherwise, we lose track of sharding candidates and currently-sharding
containers in recon when the sharding cycle time goes past an hour.

Change-Id: I8c6721d9f03c0f738254db37478e2813976fdf1a

commit_message:
Mark trunk tests as unstable

Currently failing rate is about 40% of the scenario tests in dvr
multinode flavor. Let's skip the trunk tests as they might be the last
one failing while in parallel attempting to troubleshoot the issue and
working on the fix.

Change-Id: I29f1dc56273a71789474596ffee1688d3443d3bc
Related-bug: #1766701

commit_message:
Fix: sphinx-docs job for stable branch and pep8 issues

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on stable branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to pip.

Pep8 job is broken due to recent pep8 upgrade and corresponding
pycodestyle update.

This commit fixes the following errors:
  - E731 do not assign a lambda expression, use a def
  - W503 line break before binary operator
  - E402 module level import not at top of file

Change-Id: I55879d70f05de60a423176e5bf1803758f27c691

commit_message:
certificates: fix copying files in multi-node env

ansible's `copy` command has `remote_src: no` by default
and it copies file from localhost to remote.
but copying of created CA certificate should be on remote node.

Change-Id: I1d2c728ffff89a7e1090924e14e4d219c5e8ca93

commit_message:
Fix build with Sphinx 1.7.x

In sphinx 1.7, the sphinx.util.compat.Directive class doesn't exist
anymore, it's available in docutils.parsers.rst.Directive instead,
and it was deprecated in Sphinx 1.6 already. This patch makes it
therefore work in both version 1.6 and 1.7 just by using the new
module path docutils.parsers.rst.Directive.

Change-Id: I2e05c1612c687c029174f045d3ea0fec83e1119a

commit_message:
Fanout the db sync to all cells if --local_cell is False

This implements what was more or less a TODO in the
nova-manage db sync command such that it makes the command
perform a global database sync of all of the cell mappings.

This is needed for a change in devstack to sync a database
for a 2nd cell to manage the subnode in a multinode/cell setup:

I6d263c81579f8c52dcf4cb9a0085c64545ee13e5

Change-Id: I4fb1c966e6e011b73d42a1629718abf1adc8125f

Question: Prometheus doesn't have authentication system, so every body can access to the web service. Is it easy to configure a reverse proxy (haproxy) to add authentication? regards"}, {'account_id': 17938, 'date': '2017-07-26 14:13:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

> Question: Prometheus doesn't have authentication system, so every
 > body can access to the web service. Is it easy to configure a
 > reverse proxy (haproxy) to add authentication? regards

Prometheus does not really care about server-side security. You can read more about this here https://www.robustperception.io/prometheus-security-authentication-authorization-and-encryption/ Compared to the log analytics stack we're running in Kolla-ansible (Elasticsearch + Kibana) Prometheus is not too different: Prometheus is the database like Elasticsearch but for timeseries data. Elasticsearch does not do any authentication either: You can delete indices simply by curling the right URL. Kibana adds authentication and so does Grafana which is the dashboarding solution to prometheus."}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2017-07-26 14:26:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-07-27 08:23:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Verified-1

commit_message:
Add role to deploy prometheus

This patch adds the ansible role to deploy the prometheus service which
can be used to collect performance metrics accross the environment

Partially-Implements: blueprint prometheus
Change-Id: I908b9c9dad63ab5c9b80be1e3a80a4fc8191cb9e

commit_message:
Add instance interfaces tab for easy security group edit

There is no easy way to edit security groups of ports attached
to an instance. This commit adds a table of ports attached to
an insntace to the instance detail. Users now can access attached
ports easily and edit their security groups.

Partial-Bug: #1750147
Change-Id: Ia2bd19f92251702878be3b12d0ea2a5c6618c65e

commit_message:
Move SECRET_KEY and LOCAL_PATH code out of settings.py

Also, changed the defaults for SECRET_KEY and LOCAL_PATH in
local_settings.py, so that there is no code in the settings.
This doesn't change the behavior -- that is, the key is still
getting generated.

Change-Id: Ic959b9916690a9fc05c0e7c585229452197fa894
Partially-Implements: blueprint ini-based-configuration

commit_message:
Move the execution of local_settings.d snippets into a function

This code really makes me uncomfortable, but since it's there, I guess
we need to keep it. I used an execfile instead of reading the file
manually.

Change-Id: I4da6579ed5eb8c67e0f553897e1cae92cf152fd0
Partially-Implements: blueprint ini-based-configuration

subject: Move warnings from settings.py to a separate function

commit_message:
Move warnings from settings.py to a separate function

We could even write some tests for it now, but at the
moment they would be rather trivial. However, it may
be actually needed when it gets more complex.

Change-Id: I68c90030ed1c11ce0c6adc15e5842ae5011b7301
Partially-Implements: blueprint ini-based-configuration

commit_message:
Replace all mentions of get_identity_providers with get_identity_provider

There was a typo in keystone's policy files, and it has been fixed in
Keystone already, we should also fix it to match.

Change-Id: I41e4381765f3bfc5988ca235e6cbeb6d1ba62fc2
Closes-bug: #1703369

commit_message:
Require the (soon-to-be) Rocky version of Horizon

... or at least the first published tarball which will lead to Rocky.
On the other side this means forcing the usage of mox as long as
there are tests that depends on it (the switch was already flipped
in Horizon, so it needs to be enabled here).

This allows us to depend on newer Horizon features, including changes
to the test suite that are useful for the mox removal effort.

Change-Id: Ibf95b642f49aee9b3165f46e0422ff6bf56e9391

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-25 12:29:15.000000000', 'message': 'Fix XMLRPC URL after Pypi URL update

A seemingly-trivial change updated the URL for the
XMLRPC Pypi service from https://pypi.python.org/pypi
to https://pypi.org/project, while the XMLRPC service
lives at https://pypi.org/pypi. This resulted in
systematic validation failures.

Change-Id: I97218093a9346a7d84f58136764cce53930ddacb
'}]
commit_message:
Fix XMLRPC URL after Pypi URL update

A seemingly-trivial change updated the URL for the
XMLRPC Pypi service from https://pypi.python.org/pypi
to https://pypi.org/project, while the XMLRPC service
lives at https://pypi.org/pypi. This resulted in
systematic validation failures.

Change-Id: I97218093a9346a7d84f58136764cce53930ddacb

commit_message:
bootstrap-host: Set repo build pip default mirror when in openstack-ci

When in openstack-ci we should use the most local pypi mirror
available for the repo build process to speed things up.

Change-Id: I9e6c209bafa21afe22e0c4f67da584d553a50e00
(cherry picked from commit aac7e8ce1864dd1db0d8fb6008d20e62f2b5a38a)

Currently we only collect periodic tasks from interfaces used in enabled
classic drivers. Meaning, periodics are not collected from interfaces
that are only used in hardware types. This patch corrects it.

This patch does not enable collection of periodic tasks from hardware
types, since we did not collect them from classic drivers. I don't
remember the reason for that, and we may want to fix it later.

commit_message:
Collect periodic tasks from all enabled hardware interfaces

Currently we only collect periodic tasks from interfaces used in enabled
classic drivers. Meaning, periodics are not collected from interfaces
that are only used in hardware types. This patch corrects it.

This patch does not enable collection of periodic tasks from hardware
types, since we did not collect them from classic drivers. I don't
remember the reason for that, and we may want to fix it later.

Change-Id: Ib1963f3f67a758a6b2405387bfe7b3e30cc31ed8
Story: #2001884
Task: #14357

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-16 09:33:27.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: fix wrong driver name for vhostuser interface

The driver name for vhostuser interface should always be
vhostuser. This commit specifically fix that point.

Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ic6f1260378e233634a9e5b53f82d7f59461a474f
'}, {'created': '2018-04-16 18:50:58.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: fix wrong driver name for vhostuser interface

This is currently ignored when we have a vif_type of vhostuser, which
means we're setting "vhost" by default when we are really "vhostuser".
This sets it to vhostuser for clarity (and in case something below us
ever starts noticing that we are being inconsistent).

Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ic6f1260378e233634a9e5b53f82d7f59461a474f
'}, {'created': '2018-04-17 15:03:34.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: fix wrong driver name for vhostuser interface

This is currently ignored when we have a vif_type of vhostuser, which
means we're setting "vhost" by default when we are really
"vhost-user".  This sets it to vhost-user for clarity (and in case
something below us ever starts noticing that we are being
inconsistent).

Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ic6f1260378e233634a9e5b53f82d7f59461a474f
'}, {'created': '2018-04-19 15:35:02.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: fix wrong driver name for vhostuser interface

This is currently ignored for (qemu/vhost) option when we have a
vif_type of vhostuser, which means we're setting "vhost". libvirt is
doing bad job at accepting this value.

The fix is setting the driver name to None when vif is vhostuser.

commit_message:
libvirt: fix wrong driver name for vhostuser interface

This is currently ignored for (qemu/vhost) option when we have a
vif_type of vhostuser, which means we're setting "vhost". libvirt is
doing bad job at accepting this value.

The fix is setting the driver name to None when vif is vhostuser.

Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ic6f1260378e233634a9e5b53f82d7f59461a474f

commit_message:
k8s_fedora: Add flannel to master nodes

To allow ther api server access pods, we need
flannel to be running on the master node.
* Run flannel on the master node in a system
  container.

Change-Id: Ic0996ba36e335e970f3d2255840b24a8b4f738b8
Closes-Bug: #1757936

commit_message:
[dashboard] Modify bgpvpn router associations

This patch add a button "create router association" in bgpvpn panels.
It open a form to add only one network association with optionals parameters.

The bgpvpn overview details is more complete. There is
now a router associations tab which list all the router
associations. It's possible to delete each router
association and to update it.

Change-Id: Idd5af2ce2d4d864882c6191d648d16d9d9bcf35f
Partially-Implements: blueprint routes-control

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2018-03-29 15:31:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19: Code-Review-1

There is one thing missing in this change, that I think we agreed was useful is the ability to create a network association for a BGPVPN, from the tab listing network associations in the view displaying the BGPVPN.'}, {'account_id': 21800, 'date': '2018-04-05 07:27:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

> There is one thing missing in this change, that I think we agreed
 > was useful is the ability to create a network association for a
 > BGPVPN, from the tab listing network associations in the view
 > displaying the BGPVPN.

I'm not sure to understand. In the network associations tab it's possible to create an association. The button is in the top right of the page with the button "Edit BGPVPN".'}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2018-04-05 08:09:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

> > There is one thing missing in this change, that I think we agreed
 > > was useful is the ability to create a network association for a
 > > BGPVPN, from the tab listing network associations in the view
 > > displaying the BGPVPN.
 > 
 > I'm not sure to understand. In the network associations tab it's
 > possible to create an association. The button is in the top right
 > of the page with the button "Edit BGPVPN".

What I think would be natural would be a "Create Network Association" button, inside the "Network Associations" tab.  

From a US standpoint, it's nice if what is proposed to the user takes into account the context which the user has chosen (here the Network Associations tab), rather
than require the user to choose again.  It is also better if a natural action is directly accessible rather than hidden inside a dropdown list.'}, {'account_id': 21800, 'date': '2018-04-05 08:48:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20.'}, {'account_id': 21800, 'date': '2018-04-05 08:50:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 21.'}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2018-04-05 10:11:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21: Code-Review+2

This patch add a button "create network association" in bgpvpn panels. It
open a form to add only one network association.

possible to delete each network association. It's inspired by the network
panel which include subnets and ports tabs on the overview of a network.

It will be easier in the future to add others associations as routers and
ports with the same logical with new tab in bgpvpn overview details.

commit_message:
[dashboard] Modify bgpvpn network associations

This patch adds a button "create network association" in bgpvpn panels. It
opens a form to add only one network association.

The bgpvpn overview details is more complete. There is now a
network associations tab which list all the network associations. It's
possible to delete each network association. It's inspired by the network
panel which include subnets and ports tabs on the overview of a network.

It will be easier in the future to add others associations as routers and
ports with the same logical with new tab in bgpvpn overview details.

Change-Id: I6280b53558b6b52081ee6d629e8f3963d8dfc346

[{'created': '2018-01-08 04:37:51.000000000', 'message': "Remove ordering attempts of 'unorderable types'

Python 3 is more strict in ordering container elements and raises errors
when attempted to order unorderable types like dicts.
So, fix such places and replace them with proper things.

Ref: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/210252/

Change-Id: I47f2e61d0721ec2759427dd0be0e22c15b21e1a6
Partially-Implements: bp py3-compatibility
"}]
commit_message:
Remove ordering attempts of 'unorderable types'

Python 3 is more strict in ordering container elements and raises errors
when attempted to order unorderable types like dicts.
So, fix such places and replace them with proper things.

Ref: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/210252/

Change-Id: I47f2e61d0721ec2759427dd0be0e22c15b21e1a6
Partially-Implements: bp py3-compatibility

commit_message:
Fix incompatible requirement

- Fix lower-constraints don't match the lower bounds
in the requirements file(s). It may cause fail in
requirements-check.

Example fail: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/555209/

REF:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129056.html

- Fix incompatible of eventlet in requirement.txt

Change-Id: I85486f47e08bac6cfb481871861f37d692025f58

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-23 08:27:11.000000000', 'message': 'Allow pypiserver to be upgraded before repo build

To cater for a situation where the pypiserver package is changing,
but the repo does not yet have the package built, we need to ensure
that the install task for it can fetch from pypi (or the designated
pypi mirror). To do this we try the local repo first, then fall back
to using the designated default index which defaults to pypi.

Change-Id: I1a2d36793fccc4c50f00247c8d19501ad8816517
(cherry picked from commit 4e3213f4c6618235aa93bd994166799c06ccb7a5)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow pypiserver to be upgraded before repo build

To cater for a situation where the pypiserver package is changing,
but the repo does not yet have the package built, we need to ensure
that the install task for it can fetch from pypi (or the designated
pypi mirror). To do this we try the local repo first, then fall back
to using the designated default index which defaults to pypi.

Change-Id: I1a2d36793fccc4c50f00247c8d19501ad8816517
(cherry picked from commit 4e3213f4c6618235aa93bd994166799c06ccb7a5)

commit_message:
Fix pep8 new warnings

A recent change in pep/pycodingchecks introduced new warnings as part of
the pep8 target that causes pep8 to fail now.

This patch fixes code that issued warnings W503,E731,E266,E402

In addition, old tests which were not ran anyway, and are no longer relevant (test_firewall)
were deleted.

Conflicts:
	neutron_fwaas/tests/tempest_plugin/tests/scenario/manager.py

Change-Id: Ic784775535547160a0dc0af5d5debfbb1833c6ba

commit_message:
Q upgrade - fixup completion messages and --help doctext

This fixes a nit in the upgrade prepare completion message and
adds missing completion messages for run and converge. I also
added missing doctext - it is useful as it is what the operator
sees with --help

(cherry picked from commit e9baead0741db6bde67fc9301432ad69ff9d98a5)

commit_message:
Add external DNS server to the /etc/resolv.conf

This is required to resolve CentOS repos for libvirt
install.
Adding an external DNS server to /etc/dhcp/dhclient.conf
will survive a reboot with DHCP. Using the 'supersede'
option will ensure the external server is used first.

Change-Id: Ib62f155f349a8db5ed0ef8b107418ce29a658c30

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-12 15:48:01.000000000', 'message': "Add support for key manager configuration

A support for propagation of key manager configuration from
calling charms into OSD preparation codepaths; this is used
predominately in the 'vault' key management approach where
the block device is encrypted outside of ceph-volume/ceph-disk
vs the 'ceph' key management approach where ceph tools take
responsibility for management of the keys lower down the stack.

The 'vault' key management approach is integrated in the
_initialize_disk function - if vault is selected as the key
manager, then vaultlocker is used to encrypt and open the disk;
the resulting /dev/mapper/crypt-<UUID> device is then used
for LVM, rather than the underlying partition.

Change-Id: If73e7bd518a7bc60c2db08e2aa3a93dcfe79c0dd

commit_message:
Add support for key manager configuration

Add support for propagation of key manager configuration from
calling charms into OSD preparation codepaths; this is used
predominately in the 'vault' key management approach where
the block device is encrypted outside of ceph-volume/ceph-disk
vs the 'ceph' key management approach where ceph tools take
responsibility for management of the keys lower down the stack.

The 'vault' key management approach is integrated in the
_initialize_disk function - if vault is selected as the key
manager, then vaultlocker is used to encrypt and open the disk;
the resulting /dev/mapper/crypt-<UUID> device is then used
for LVM, rather than the underlying partition.

Change-Id: If73e7bd518a7bc60c2db08e2aa3a93dcfe79c0dd

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-23 08:25:38.000000000', 'message': "Override the pip index used for the wheel build

When doing the wheel build we need to ensure that we make
use of the pypi mirror directly.

When upgrading, if we leave it to the pip.conf file contents,
it will only use the contents of the pypiserver which locks
it down to the wheels built for the version we're upgrading
from. The wheel build therefore fails.

Leaving the pip.conf config in place is still good for
ensuring that anything installed on the repo server later uses
the pypiserver contents.

Change-Id: I5d1f33832c9738683b49384ea5ebfb571b526a81
(cherry picked from commit a25d1b41db49377c09b5e2c07ce3a38dd6e9df1c)
"}]
commit_message:
Override the pip index used for the wheel build

When doing the wheel build we need to ensure that we make
use of the pypi mirror directly.

When upgrading, if we leave it to the pip.conf file contents,
it will only use the contents of the pypiserver which locks
it down to the wheels built for the version we're upgrading
from. The wheel build therefore fails.

Leaving the pip.conf config in place is still good for
ensuring that anything installed on the repo server later uses
the pypiserver contents.

Change-Id: I5d1f33832c9738683b49384ea5ebfb571b526a81
(cherry picked from commit a25d1b41db49377c09b5e2c07ce3a38dd6e9df1c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-25 09:56:12.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure initial apparmor mode set

Due to changes in the hookenv.config charmhelper, the value of
aa-profile-mode does not change between the install and config-changed
hooks.  This results in the ceph-osd apparmor profile always
being enabled by default (rather than being disabled).

Ensure that an apparmor enforcement mode is correctly set whenever
a new profile is installed - this could either be on first install,
or if a new profile is added to the charm.

Change-Id: I131c9a871ad970b58fa6f41575c240081f653a21
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure initial apparmor mode set

Due to changes in the hookenv.config charmhelper, the value of
aa-profile-mode does not change between the install and config-changed
hooks.  This results in the ceph-osd apparmor profile always
being enabled by default (rather than being disabled).

Ensure that an apparmor enforcement mode is correctly set whenever
a new profile is installed - this could either be on first install,
or if a new profile is added to the charm.

Change-Id: I131c9a871ad970b58fa6f41575c240081f653a21

commit_message:
Add storage volume

It adds the storage volume resource of Redfish standard schema
and also provides the attribute ``max_size_bytes`` which gives
largest logical disk size available in bytes among all disk volumes.

Co-Authored-By: Nisha Agarwal <agarwalnisha1980@gmail.com>
Partial-Bug: 1751143
Change-Id: I38724275967cb01a0e905ef2a10c5b99dde482f2

commit_message:
Fix pep8 errors

Pep8 job is broken due to recent pep8 upgrade and corresponding
pycodestyle update.

This commit fixes the following errors:
  - E731 do not assign a lambda expression, use a def
  - W503 line break before binary operator
  - E402 module level import not at top of file

Change-Id: Ib357336eb165cf642f6793ff6cdde7d53075b158
(cherry picked from commit 9e479b621ba48e1c48b9c8aaaaff36268e20f543)

commit_message:
Use a nginx conf.d file for the custom logging

To cater for the situation where there are no containers, or
nginx is shared in some way, it's better to add custom directives
for nginx.conf into a conf.d file. That way it's never overwritten.

To resolve the situation where repo_server overwrites the config
laid down by os_keystone, we implement the custom log in this way.

The task which verifies that the right config directories exist
is modified to ensure that both the sites and the conf.d directories
exist before this configuration is laid down. For CentOS/OpenSUSE
they are the same directory, but for Ubuntu they are different.

This patch also ensurs that the previous implementation is removed,
otherwise an upgrade fails. This patch should be back portable to
ensure that zero-container deploys for Queens work properly.

Change-Id: I2ab0f591c1cdeae43a002d9c8cf9bbfdd69597f1

with its class full name and loads them as extra steps if any.

commit_message:
Workflow: Make steps pluggable via horizon plugin config

This commit enhances django workflow implementation to allow horizon
plugins to add workflow steps to a workflow in other repository like
the main horizon repo. New setting "EXTRA_STEPS" is introduced to
the horizon plugin 'enabled' file.
To this aim, the workflow class looks up HORIZON_CONFIG['extra_steps']
with its class full name and loads them as extra steps if any.
HORIZON_CONFIG['extra_steps'] are populated via horizon plugin settings.

This commit completes the blueprint.

blueprint horizon-plugin-tab-for-info-and-quotas

Change-Id: I347d113f47587932e4f583d3152e781ad1a4849f

commit_message:
Replace CentOS package mysql-devel > mariadb-devel

MySQL is no longer in CentOS repos. MariaDB has become the
default database offered. MariaDB is considered a binary
drop-in replacement for MySQL.
https://mariadb.com/kb/en/library/mariadb-vs-mysql-compatibility/

Change-Id: Ib0c971361ae0e5742cf0beaad2859579df601e5b

commit_message:
Added JavaScript evaluator which doesn't require a compilation

* Added new JavaScript evaluator py_mini_racer. Advantages:
    * is distributed as wheel package
    * supports differences platforms
    * live project
* BUILD_V8EVAL was removed because it was replaced by py_mini_racer in
Mistral Docker image
* Added stevedore integration to javascript evaluators
* Refreshed javascript tests. Add test for py_mini_racer evaluator
* Install py_mini_racer library in during mistral test
* Refreshed javascript action doc

Change-Id: Id9d558b9b8374a2c2639e10cb1868f4e67f96e86
Implements: blueprint mistral-add-py-mini-racer-javascript-evaluator
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>

commit_message:
Fix docker image build job

The commands need to be run as root.

Also adds a test job for the docker image build so that zuul will run
the experimental job to test before merging.

Change-Id: I1d1cb6979865d7ef22587315544f39646bc9d49d
Closes-Bug: #1765421
